page.title: 04PENSIONER 8O+ WITH WIFE
page.content: He has lived in Portchester for forty eight years and has seen Portchester change, he believes, for the better. He sees his main problem as continuing to live an active life, for he now becomes easily worn out. He sees the main national problem as unemployment, especially amongst the younger generation, brought on by recent excessive wage demands by the Trade Unions. This could be solved by bringing down the inflation rate and reducing the price of our goods abroad so that our international trade is increased and jobs can be created through this.
